instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Black screen - No Display, No Chime, Fans Spin, Green Light on Charger
threads.message:
Hello,

 I have a 2010 15" Macbook Pro that was experiencing random shutdowns and reboots during use. It has progressed to the point where it doesn't even boot into recovery mode or display anything on the screen when powering on. When the charger is plugged in it is green and when the power button is pressed the screen remains black but the fans start up with no chime noise. I've tried removing the RAM to see if I could get it to beep at me but nothing beeps or makes noise with the RAM or SSD removed. 

 I initially thought it was the kernel panic issue tied to the tantalum capacitor near the GPU so I swapped it out with a new polymer capacitor but the issue still persists exactly the same.

I have provided a gallery of photos of the board back and front and up close near each section of the board:

[URL unfurl="true"]https://postimg.cc/gallery/ktfD9hQ[/URL]

I am new to this so I have not done anything else outside of what I mentioned here. I also just subscribed to the repair forum subscription as well.

Any help would be appreciated!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Black screen - No Display, No Chime, Fans Spin, Green Light on Charger
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

You should have changed <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> early, when the problem appeared.
Something more happened, as the machine doesn't boot now.
<CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> doesn't help with actual problem, but is good to have it changed anyway.

Check if all voltages appear, especially CPU core (L7415/25).
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?

You may have problems with GPU; try to heat for test.
